name: Khala Rau (The Folklore of the Lunar Eclipse from Bali : The Rejected Giant's Love)
description:
Kala Rau is a giant figure who is immortal because he participates in drinking tirta amerta (water of immortality) while disguised as a god in the distribution of tirta amerta (holy water of life/eternity).

When Kala Rau drank tirta amerta, Lord Vishnu discovered his disguise. When the tirta amerta had reached his throat, Lord Vishnu released his arrow which caused Kala Rau's head to cut off and then floated in the sky. The remaining pieces of the headless body fell to Earth, and became dimples.

Kala Rau, who has always been in love with Dewi Ratih (Goddess of the Moon) and is always looking for her. At one time when the goddess was walking in the sky, Kala Rau tried to hold her by swallowing her. However, because Kala Rau was only a head, Dewi Ratih immediately escaped from his embrace.

===

RakaJana
2022
